text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Thursday. Reuters had not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Communist Akel is at a deadlock in its search to find a presidential candidate.
- The United Nations asks for a "moratorium" on public comments regarding the Cyprus problem from both sides.
- The chairman of the Hellenic Mining Company resigns in dispute with the archbishop.
- Getting rid of foreign workers won't get rid of unemployment, says the labour minister.
- Akel submits its proposals for the presidential elections to socialist Edek.
- The government plans increases in the price of flour, bread and grain.
- Opposition considers 10 people in search for a presidential candidate.
- Battle starts for the millions of pounds the Hellenic Mining Company is worth.
- Albania turns into a living hell. Ethnic Greeks are in danger.
- United Nations Secretary General Kofi Annan is due to meet with Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash in March.
